Description: If the human language of a part of the page changes, the language should be able to be programmatically determined
Navigation components like a navigation bar or search bar should be consistent across other pages
Components that work the same across pages should be identified the same on each page
If an error can be detected along with the reason for the error it should be stated to user unless that error would compromise security or purpose of the content

If content has a legal commitment or a financial transaction, it should either have reversible submissions, a way to check the data being entered, or a way to confirm information before it is finalized.
A cognitive test such as remembering a password is not required in any step for authentication. An example of this is allowing the use of a password manager or allowing email authentication.
